intro: Zygomenes polyrrhiza, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Zygomenes polyrrhiza typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across its native range.
